rubric.0.0: No diagnostic, SWOT, gap analysis, or baseline data is present in the document.
rubric.0.25: Very high-level or vague mention of current state without structured analysis or data.
rubric.0.5: Diagnostic exists (e.g., qualitative SWOT) but is incomplete — missing quantified baselines or gap analysis.
rubric.0.75: Well-developed diagnostic with quantified baselines but minor gaps in depth or coverage.
rubric.1.0: Comprehensive diagnostic with fully quantified baselines, structured SWOT, and detailed gap analysis.

rubric.0.0: No benchmarking or comparative analysis present.
rubric.0.25: Vague mention of peer countries or comparators without any data or specifics.
rubric.0.5: Some benchmarking present but limited in scope — few comparators or incomplete data.
rubric.0.75: Good benchmarking with multiple comparators and data, minor gaps in lessons learned.
rubric.1.0: Comprehensive benchmarking with regional/international comparators, detailed data, and documented lessons learned.

rubric.0.25: Brief or vague mention of trends without analysis or linkage to strategy.
rubric.0.5: Some trends identified but analysis is surface-level or not linked to strategic direction.
rubric.0.75: Good trends analysis covering global/regional trends with mostly clear linkage to strategy.
rubric.1.0: Comprehensive trends analysis (global, regional, sectoral) fully integrated into strategic direction.

rubric.0.25: Vision exists but is vague, generic, or not aligned with national direction.
rubric.0.5: Vision is stated but lacks ambition, specificity, or clear national alignment.
rubric.0.75: Clear and ambitious vision with good national alignment but minor clarity gaps.
rubric.1.0: Clear, ambitious, measurable vision fully aligned with Qatar national direction (QNV 2030, NDS3).

rubric.0.25: Mission exists but is vague or does not articulate purpose and scope.
rubric.0.5: Mission is stated but incomplete — missing either purpose, scope, or target beneficiaries.
rubric.0.75: Good mission statement with clear purpose and scope, minor gaps in specificity.
rubric.1.0: Comprehensive mission clearly articulating purpose, scope, and target beneficiaries.

rubric.0.25: Values mentioned but generic and not linked to entity/sector mandate.
rubric.0.5: Values defined but only partially aligned with mandate or lacking operational relevance.
rubric.0.75: Values well-defined and mostly aligned with mandate, minor gaps in operational linkage.
rubric.1.0: Values clearly defined, fully aligned with mandate, and operationally relevant.

rubric.0.0: No strategic objectives or pillars defined.
rubric.0.25: Objectives mentioned but vague, not measurable, or poorly structured.
rubric.0.5: Objectives defined but some lack measurability or clear linkage to vision.
rubric.0.75: Well-defined objectives/pillars with mostly clear measurability, minor gaps.
rubric.1.0: Comprehensive, measurable strategic objectives/pillars fully linked to vision and mission.

rubric.0.25: KPIs listed but without methodology, measurement cadence, or data source.
rubric.0.5: KPIs defined with some methodology but missing cadence, data source, or calculation details.
rubric.0.75: Good KPI definitions with methodology and cadence, minor gaps in data source or clarity.
rubric.1.0: Comprehensive KPI definitions with full methodology, measurement cadence, data source, and calculation method.

rubric.0.0: No baselines or targets provided for KPIs.
rubric.0.25: Some targets exist but no baselines, or baselines without targets.
rubric.0.5: Partial baselines and targets — some KPIs covered, others missing.
rubric.0.75: Most KPIs have baselines and targets, minor gaps in coverage or time-bounding.
rubric.1.0: All KPIs have quantified baselines and time-bound targets with clear milestones.

rubric.0.25: Brief mention of governance without roles, committees, or decision-making structure.
rubric.0.5: Some governance elements described but incomplete — missing roles or decision-making clarity.
rubric.0.75: Good internal governance with committees and roles, minor gaps in decision-making flows.
rubric.1.0: Comprehensive internal governance with clear committees, roles, responsibilities, and decision-making flows.

rubric.0.25: External stakeholders briefly mentioned without roles or engagement model.
rubric.0.5: Some external stakeholders mapped but roles or engagement mechanisms are incomplete.
rubric.0.75: Good external stakeholder mapping with roles, minor gaps in engagement mechanisms.
rubric.1.0: Comprehensive external stakeholder ecosystem with clear roles, responsibilities, and engagement model.

rubric.0.25: Vague mention of coordination without specific mechanisms or cadence.
rubric.0.5: Some coordination mechanisms exist but lack detail on cadence, format, or accountability.
rubric.0.75: Good coordination mechanisms with mostly clear cadence and format, minor gaps.
rubric.1.0: Comprehensive coordination mechanisms with clear cadence, format, escalation paths, and accountability.

rubric.0.25: Projects listed but not linked to strategic initiatives or objectives.
rubric.0.5: Some projects derived from initiatives but linkage is incomplete or unclear.
rubric.0.75: Good derivation of projects from initiatives with mostly clear linkage, minor gaps.
rubric.1.0: All projects clearly derived from strategic initiatives with full traceability to objectives.

rubric.0.0: No linkage between projects/conditions and strategic objectives.
rubric.0.25: Vague or partial linkage — some projects connected, many orphaned.
rubric.0.5: Moderate linkage — most projects connected but some lack clear objective mapping.
rubric.0.75: Good linkage with most projects mapped to objectives, minor orphan projects.
rubric.1.0: All projects and conditions explicitly mapped to strategic objectives with clear contribution logic.

rubric.0.0: No project descriptions or charters provided.
rubric.0.25: Brief project descriptions without scope, deliverables, or ownership.
rubric.0.5: Partial descriptions — some projects have scope and deliverables, others lack detail.
rubric.0.75: Good project charters with scope, deliverables, and ownership for most projects, minor gaps.
rubric.1.0: Comprehensive charters for all projects with full scope, deliverables, ownership, and success criteria.

rubric.0.25: Very high-level timeline without milestones or phasing.
rubric.0.5: Some timelines exist but inconsistent — some projects have milestones, others do not.
rubric.0.75: Good timelines with milestones and phases for most projects, minor gaps.
rubric.1.0: Detailed implementation timelines for all projects with milestones, phases, and dependencies.

rubric.0.25: High-level total budget mentioned without per-project breakdown.
rubric.0.5: Some budget allocation per project but inconsistent or missing funding sources.
rubric.0.75: Good budget allocation for most projects with funding sources, minor gaps.
rubric.1.0: Comprehensive budget allocation per project with funding sources, phasing, and cost breakdowns.

rubric.0.25: Brief or generic risk mention without categorization or assessment.
rubric.0.5: Some risks identified but lacking systematic categorization, likelihood, or impact assessment.
rubric.0.75: Good risk identification with categorization and mostly assessed likelihood/impact, minor gaps.
rubric.1.0: Comprehensive risk register with systematic identification, categorization, likelihood, and impact assessment.

rubric.0.25: Generic mitigation mentioned without specific actions or ownership.
rubric.0.5: Some mitigation strategies defined but not all risks covered or lacking ownership.
rubric.0.75: Good mitigation strategies for most risks with ownership, minor gaps in coverage.
rubric.1.0: Comprehensive mitigation strategies for all identified risks with clear ownership, timelines, and contingency plans.
